input_args.examples: {'document_id': ['0000059', '0000059', '0000059', '0000059'], 'document_source': ['NIHSeniorHealth', 'NIHSeniorHealth', 'NIHSeniorHealth', 'NIHSeniorHealth'], 'document_url': ['http://nihseniorhealth.gov/psoriasis/toc.html', 'http://nihseniorhealth.gov/psoriasis/toc.html', 'http://nihseniorhealth.gov/psoriasis/toc.html', 'http://nihseniorhealth.gov/psoriasis/toc.html'], 'category': [None, None, None, None], 'umls_cui': ['C0033860', 'C0033860', 'C0033860', 'C0033860'], 'umls_semantic_types': ['T047', 'T047', 'T047', 'T047'], 'umls_semantic_group': ['Disorders', 'Disorders', 'Disorders', 'Disorders'], 'synonyms': [None, None, None, None], 'question_id': ['0000059-17', '0000059-18', '0000059-19', '0000059-20'], 'question_focus': ['Psoriasis', 'Psoriasis', 'Psoriasis', 'Psoriasis'], 'question_type': ['treatment', 'information', 'information', 'treatment'], 'question': ['What are the treatments for Psoriasis ?', 'What is (are) Psoriasis ?', 'What is (are) Psoriasis ?', 'What are the treatments for Psoriasis ?'], 'answer': ['Topical treatments are those that are applied directly to the skin. Topical treatments for psoriasis include - salicylic acid,  - steroid-based creams  - calcipotriene-containing ointment  - anthralin  - coal-tar ointments and shampoos  - and vitamin D analogues.  salicylic acid, steroid-based creams calcipotriene-containing ointment anthralin coal-tar ointments and shampoos and vitamin D analogues.', 'Oral or injected medications for psoriasis include methotrexate, cycloclosporine, oral retinoids, and biologics. These therapies, prescribed by your doctor, work in different ways to help control the underlying disease process.', 'Light therapy, also called phototherapy, uses ultraviolet light to treat skin lesions. Laser therapy delivers intense, focused doses of light to specific areas of the skin to clear lesions without harming surrounding tissues.', 'For many people, natural treatments can help relieve the symptoms of psoriasis. There are many natural treatments you can try on your own, but you should never use them to replace the treatment your doctor prescribes. Some natural treatments you may want to try are - sunlight  - aloe  - fish oil  - Dead Sea salts  - cayenne. sunlight aloe fish oil Dead Sea salts cayenne.']}
